page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: Most clubs in Weaverham you have to pay for. Some clubs are Cubs, Scouts, Sea Scouts, Brownies and Guides for children. Other clubs are the Youth club, Boxing club, Ju-jitsu and St Johns Ambulance. Sea Scouts is a club in which you can do canoeing, sailing almost anything on water. The Scout movement was started by a man called Baden Powell who went scouting him self in the Boer War . The learner pool in Weaverham is a popular place for recreation for the young. The main job for the pool keeper is to purify the water and keep it clean. In the afternoon there's a few mothers with their young children. The pool water needs testing twice a day.
